intro: Utricularia bosminifera, commonly known as the Bosmina waterwheel, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. The plant is characterized by its intricate network of leaf-like structures that form a floating bladderworts system. Its unique trapping mechanism involves small, bladder-like structures that capture tiny aquatic organisms. Utricularia bosminifera plays an important ecological role in its environment by controlling populations of microorganisms and contributing to nutrient cycling.
